channel.title: Lifehacker
channel.description: Computers make us more productive. Yeah, right. Lifehacker recommends the software downloads and web sites that actually save time. Don't live to geek; geek to live.
channel.feedburner:browserFriendly: This is an XML content feed. It is intended to be viewed in a newsreader or syndicated to another site.

item.title: Glowing Tron-Inspired Messenger Bag Lights Up the Night [Video]
item.description: Whether you want to get a jump on next year's Halloween costume or you just want to rock the only glowing messenger bag in town, this DIY electronics tutorial makes it easy to add Tron-style glowing lines to any fabric. More »
item.dc:creator: Jason Fitzpatrick

item.title: Build a Custom Espresso Cart from IKEA Parts [Video]
item.description: If you're looking for a way to control the gadget clutter sprawling around your espresso machine this simple DIY station made from IKEA parts—completely with built-in knock-box and under-machine storage—should do the trick. More »
item.dc:creator: Jason Fitzpatrick

item.title: Ask the Commenters Roundup [Hive Mind]
item.description:
• I'm due in 25 days and looking for some great New Mom Hacks. Any suggestions?
  • What DIY presents are you making this year?
  • What's the best way to burn DVD movies for maximum player compatibility?
  • Is there a Windows program that will alert me when a laptop is running on battery (not just low on battery life)?
  • What security hacks would you recommend for leaving your house unoccupied while traveling?
  • How would you stock a casual home bar to cheaply support a large number of drink combinations?
  • What's the best netbook/laptop for Hackintosh builds?
  • Is there anyway to convert Readitlater bookmarks into epub documents to put on my ebook reader?
  • What's a good solution for a DIY camera speed strap?
  • What are your favorite tech tools for weight loss?
More »

item.title: Compose with Fibonacci's Ratio for Phenomenal Photos [Photography Tip]
item.description: If you're looking for a way to draw more attention to the crucial elements in your photographic composition, the Fibonacci Ratio offers a way to direct your viewers eye to the critical parts of your photo. More »
item.dc:creator: Jason Fitzpatrick

item.title: Remap Your Capslock Key sans AutoHotkey or Third Party Apps [Downloads]
item.description: Windows: If you'd like to remap your Capslock key to another function without running AutoHotkey scripts or other third party solutions this reader suggested solution uses the Remapkey tool from the Windows Server Resource Kit to solve the problem. More »
item.dc:creator: Java Princess

item.title: Turn an iPhone into a Portable and Compact Teleprompter [Video]
item.description: Just because you use an ultra-portable camera in the field doesn't mean you have to give up niceties like a teleprompter. This DIY project mates a Flip UltraHD camcorder with an iPhone-turned-teleprompter for on-the-go prompting. More »
item.dc:creator: Jason Fitzpatrick

item.title: Five Best Virtual Machine Applications [Hive Five]
item.description: Most modern computers are powerful enough to run entire operating systems within your main operating systems, which means virtual machines are more commonplace today than ever. Here's a look at the five most popular virtual machine applications. More »
item.dc:creator: Jason Fitzpatrick

item.title: Roll Cookie Dough from the Center for Softer Cookies [Food Hacks]
item.description: If your cut-out style Christmas cookies seem a bit on the tough side, your rolling technique might be to blame. Roll the dough from the center outwards for softer cookies. More »
item.dc:creator: Jason Fitzpatrick

item.title: This Week's Top Downloads [Download Roundup]
item.description:
• Microsoft Security Essentials 2 Released, Still the Best Darn Antivirus Around (Windows)
    We've learned to stop worrying about antivirus software since Microsoft released their great Microsoft Security Essentials suite, but today it gets even better, improving Windows Firewall integration, network traffic inspection, and an heuristic scanning engine.
  • Power Control Plus Toggles Nearly Any Android Setting with One Tap (Android)
    We've sung the praises of the Android Power Control widget on more than one occasion, but if you wish you could toggle even more settings right from your home screen, Power Widget Plus will probably let you do so.
  • Google Maps 5.0 Blows Other Maps Out of the Water with 3D Compass Mode and Offline Navigation (Android)
    Google Maps on Android has always been great, but today's update brings it to a new level of awesome, adding 3D maps, compass mode, and offline caching so you can get anywhere you need to go-even without internet.
  • Dropbox Hits Version 1.0, Brings Big Performance Boosts and Selective Sync (Windows/Mac)
    Our favorite file-syncing tool, and yours, just hit version 1.0, leaving beta and adding the long-awaited selective syncing features, as well as a significant speed increase.
  • Opera 11 Debuts with Extensions, Tab Stacking, Gestures, and More (Windows/Mac/Linux)
    Opera's out with the official release of version 11, a fast, shiny browser that offers a growing add-on market, clever tab stacking, right-click navigation gestures, and more features you'll see in other browsers in the future.
  • Word Lens is a Mind-Blowing App that Translates Any Text Your Camera Can See On the Fly (iOS)
    Word Lens is an app for your iPhone or iPod touch that translates any Spanish or English text your camera can see. And it does it on the fly. And it's amazing.
  • Disconnect for Chrome Disables Third-Party Tracking While Keeping Webapps Operational (Chrome)
    It always seems like a simple, if brutal, call: either keep your cookies, or lose access to a working Gmail, Facebook, and other neat services. Enter Disconnect, an extension that de-personalizes your browsing without cutting off necessary functionality.
  • FlashVideoReplacer Replaces Flash Videos with Windows Media, QuickTime Equivalents (Firefox)
    Everyone's trying to avoid Flash these days, what with its CPU-hogging and battery draining. If you need to watch videos on sites like YouTube or Vimeo, though, you can replace them with lower-power Quicktime and WMV plugins with FlashVideoReplacer.
  • mSpot Stores 2 GB of Your Music Online, Streams It to Your Smartphone (Windows/Mac and iOS/Android)
    mSpot takes your iTunes playlists and other music and stores it on 2 GB of free server space. It then beams and syncs that music to a browser, an Android device, and, new today, iPhones and other iOS devices.
  • SwapWin Swaps Windows Between Dual Monitors (Windows)
    Dual monitors are great for productivity. You can reference something on one monitor while working on the other, but if you find that the work on your secondary monitor requires more attention, free app SwapWin can swap your active windows instantly.
More »

item.title: XBMC Updates to 10.0 Dharma, Rocks Awesome Add-on Support and Improved Graphic Acceleration [Video]
item.description: Windows/Mac/Linux: XBMC, the awesome open-source and highly-customizable media center, updates to XBMC 10.0 Dharma today with some serious changes under the hood—including an absolutely awesome upgrade to the add-on framework. More »
item.dc:creator: Jason Fitzpatrick
